DefaultValue: AMP Powered ARK: Survival Evolved Server
Description: Set the name of the server as it appears publicly. Don't include a question mark
Sets the player welcome message (MOTD)
Sets the time period for display of the MOTD
Sets the map for the server. If Custom is selected, Custom Map Name must also be set
Sets a custom map for the server. "Custom" type must be selected under Map, and the map files included in ShooterGame/Content/Mods. Automatically Manage Mods can be used for this purpose

If set, enables automatic mod download and updating (on server start). Specify the relevant mods under Mods List. Alternatively, specify them in Game.ini under the heading [ModInstaller] and with one mod per line in the format: ModIDS=<value>

Comma-separated and ordered list of IDs of mods to load (map mods will not load unless named as a "Custom" map under Custom Map Name). ONE LINE ONLY! Mod files must be in ShooterGame/Content/Mods. If "Automatically Manage Mods" is enabled, the mods listed will be installed by the server

Sets the server's active event, if any. Some events may only work partially or not at all. Most special event assets are removed after the event. Use Custom and set Custom Event Name for an event not listed
Sets a custom active event name for the server. "Custom" type must be selected under Active Event
List of [Steam64 IDs](https://steamidfinder.com/) for whitelisted server admins. These admins do not need to use the server admin password

See the Security and Privacy menu for configurable options for the server's RCON password. The RCON password is also used in the in-game console for players to access administrator commands (unless they are whitelisted)
Sets the password for players to join the server. Don't include a question mark
If set, only players with Steam64 IDs listed under Whitelisted Players can join the server
List of [Steam64 IDs](https://steamidfinder.com/) for whitelisted players
Sets the password for non-admin spectators on the server. Don't include a question mark
Sets the maximum number of players allowed on the server

If required, you can change the binding of the server and RCON by changing the 'Server IP Address' setting under Security and Privacy. NOTE: The IP must be reachable by AMP, otherwise AMP's console won't work
If set, BattlEye will be disabled on the server
If set, enables crossplay between Epic Game Store players and Steam players. Do not enable Epic Only at the same time
If set, only Epic Game Store players will be able to connect to the server. Do not enable Crossplay at the same time
Sets the public IP for Epic Game Store players to connect to. If not set, and MultiHome IP Binding is specified but is not a public IP, then Epic Game Store players will not be able to connect
If set, enables Vivox on Steam only servers (Vivox is the default for Epic Game Store enabled servers)
If set, disables Valve Anti-Cheat (VAC). Only works on PC
Sets a banlist to disallow access to the server to specified players (identified by Steam64 ID). Use either the global banlist of ARK, or a custom banlist URL
If set, all admin commands used will be logged to in-game chat
If set, characters that have not moved or interacted within the Kick Idle Players Period will be kicked from the server
Sets the time period after which characters that have not moved or interacted will be kicked (if Kick Idle Players is enabled)
Sets the interval for automatic saves. 0 = constant saving, 9000000 = effectively disabled
Sets the language of the server

Sets custom [command line flags](https://ark.wiki.gg/wiki/Server_configuration#Command_Line) for the server (those that start with a - (dash)). Include the dash and separate with a space. Don't use flags already in AMP's settings!

Sets custom [command line options](https://ark.wiki.gg/wiki/Server_configuration#Command_Line) for the server (those that start with a ? (question mark)). Include the question mark but do not separate with a space. Don't use options already in AMP's settings!
If set, PvE will be enabled, and PvP disabled

If set, the Offline Raiding Prevention option will be enabled in PvP mode, preventing damage to a player's structures and creatures while the player is offline. For tribe creatures and structures, all tribe members must be offline
Sets the time period after which an logged off player will be considered offline for the Offline Raiding Prevention option
If set, enables hardcore mode, meaning player characters revert to level 1 upon death
If enabled, sets the server difficulty level to the value set under "Difficulty Override Level". This is generally the recommended way to set the difficulty level
Sets the value of the difficulty level to be applied if "Override Official Difficulty" is enabled, allowing the level to go above the default 4.0. Be careful not to go too high!
As an alternative to using "Override Official Difficulty", this setting sets the difficulty offset, which is used to calculate the [difficulty level](https://ark.wiki.gg/wiki/Difficulty)
If set, each player will be shown a crosshair
If set, the HUD (head-up display) will always be disabled
If set, shows each player their own precise position when they view their map
If set, third person view is enabled
If set, damage caused is shown in a RPG style pop-up text
If set, player characters spawn and respawn without the wake-up animation
If set, disables creature mate boosting
If set, enables optional hit markers for ranged attacks
Sets the maximum number of tamed creatures on the server. This is a global cap
Sets the maximum number of tamed creatures that a tribe is allowed to have
Sets the maximum number of slots for uploaded creatures
Sets the maximum number of structures that can be constructed within a certain range
Sets the maximum number of slots for uploaded items and resources
Sets the maximum number of players in each tribe. 0 = no limit, 1 = tribes effectively disabled
If set, tribes will be prevented from creating alliances
If set, prevents friendly fire among tribe-mates, tribe-creatures and tribe-structures on PvP servers
If set, prevents friendly fire among tribe-mates, tribe-creatures and tribe-structures on PvE servers
If set, allows gamma changes in PvP mode
If set, prevents gamma changes in PvE mode
If set, players will always be notified if someone joins the server
If set, players will always be notified if someone leaves the server
If set, voice chat will be enabled globally
If set, only players near each other can see each other's chat messages
If set, allows building in caves in PvE mode
If set, flyers will be permitted to pick up other creatures and players when mounted by a player in PvE mode
If set, flyers can have their movement speed levelled up
If set, flyers will always be allowed into caves
If set, wild creatures will not be spawned in the server. For an existing server, existing creatures need to be wiped with the admin command "destroywilddinos"
If set, creatures in inactive zones will not hibernate, at the cost of performance and memory usage
If set, all wild creatures that are not currently being tamed will be destroyed on server start
DisplayName: Force Wild Creature Respawn On Start

Description: Sets the period to force respawns of wild creatures to prevent certain types (like the Basilo and Spino) from becoming depopulated on long running servers, as well as removing any lingering event creatures. 0 = disabled
DisplayName: Force Wild Creature Respawn At Interval

Description: If set, the Tek Railgun will be disabled in PvP mode
If set, loot crates will not spawn. Artifact crates will still spawn
Sets the distance around players where resources are not allowed to grow back. Values higher than 1 increase it, values between 0 and 1 reduce it
DisplayName: Player Radius For No Resource Replenish

Description: Sets the distance around structures where resources are not allowed to grow back. Values higher than 1 increase it, values between 0 and 1 reduce it
DisplayName: Structure Radius For No Resource Replenish

Description: If set, the gradual (7 days) decay (or unclaiming) of creature ownership will be disabled in PvE mode. Otherwise, every creature can be claimed by any player
If set, the gradual decay (or unclaiming) of creature ownership will be enabled in PvP mode
If set, wild creatures and riderless creatures can take damage from passive defence structures like spikewalls
If set, diseases will be completely disabled on the server
If set, diseases will not be permanent (they will be lost on respawn)
If set, enables anyone to "take care" of baby creatures (cuddle etc), not just whomever imprinted on it
If set, disables the creature imprinting player Stat Bonus (where whomever specifically imprinted on the creature, and raised it to have an imprinting quality, gets extra damage/resistance buff)
If set, water pipes will be destroyed automatically after two real-time days, if unconnected to any non-pipe (directly or indirectly) and no allied player is nearby
Sets the cooldown period between allowed creature re-uploads
If set, claimable decayed creatures will be auto-destroyed on load, rather than remaining around as claimable
If set, optimizes the server performance when using a higher Harvest Amount Multiplier, by reducing the bias towards yielding rarer items
If set, allows flyers to fly with C4 attached to them. Otherwise, except for Quetzal and Wyvern, they can't fly
If enabled, more than one C4 can be attached per creature
If set, flyers can recover stamina when a player is standing on them instead of riding
If set, fog is disabled
If enabled, supply drops will be in random locations. NOTE: This setting is known to cause artifacts to become inaccessible on the Ragnarok map
If set, enables tribute download of non-native creatures on the Aberration map
DisplayName: Allow Foreign Creature Downloads on Aberration

Description: Sets the scaling factor for the server day/night cycle. The default value 1 sets the same speed as a singleplayer game, ie 1 minute real time = approx 28 minutes server time. A scale of 0.035 would set a day/night cycle of approx 24 hours real time
Sets the scaling factor for the length of each server day, relative to the length of each night. Lowering this value increases the day length
Sets the scaling factor for the length of each server night, relative to the length of each day. Lowering this value increases the night length

Sets the scaling factor for experience (XP) received by players, tribes and creatures for various actions. The default value 1 provides the same experience as a singleplayer game. Higher values increase XP amounts awarded, lower values decrease it
Sets the scaling factor for player characters' food consumption. Higher values increase food consumption (player characters get hungry faster)
Sets the scaling factor for player characters' water consumption. Higher values increase water consumption (player characters get thirsty faster)
Sets the scaling factor for player characters' health recovery. Higher values increase the recovery rate (player characters heal faster)
Sets the scaling factor for player characters' stamina consumption. Higher values increase stamina consumption (player characters get tired faster)
Sets the scaling factor for the damage that players cause with their attacks. The default value 1 causes normal damage. Higher values increase damage, lower values decrease it

Sets the scaling factor for players' damage resistance when attacked. The default value 1 causes normal damage. Higher values decrease resistance, increasing damage per attack. Lower values increase it, reducing damage per attack
Sets the scaling factor for creatures' food consumption. Higher values increase food consumption (creatures get hungry faster)
Sets the scaling factor for creatures' health recovery. Higher values increase the recovery rate (creatures heal faster)
Sets the scaling factor for creatures' stamina consumption. Higher values increase stamina consumption (creatures get tired faster)
Sets the scaling factor for the damage that wild creatures cause with their attacks. The default value 1 causes normal damage. Higher values increase damage, lower values decrease it

Sets the scaling factor for wild creatures' damage resistance when attacked. The default value 1 causes normal damage. Higher values decrease resistance, increasing damage per attack. Lower values increase it, reducing damage per attack
Sets the scaling factor for creature spawns. Higher values increase the number of creatures spawned throughout the server
Set the scaling factor for the unclaiming speed of creatures in PvE mode
Sets the scaling factor for the damage that structures (spikewalls) cause with their attacks. The default value 1 causes normal damage. Higher values increase damage, lower values decrease it

Sets the scaling factor for structures' damage resistance when attacked. The default value 1 causes normal damage. Higher values decrease resistance, increasing damage per attack. Lower values increase it, reducing damage per attack
Sets the scaling factor for the decay rate of player structures in PvE mode
Sets the scaling factor for the maximum number of structures placeable on platform saddles and rafts. NOTE: high values may lead to lag
Sets the scaling factor, relative to the period for allowing claims, to automatically destroy structures if there has been no near tribe player during that time

Sets the scaling factor for yields from all harvesting activities (chopping down trees, picking berries, carving carcasses, mining rocks, etc). Higher values increase the amount harvested with each strike
Sets the scaling factor for the "health" of harvestable items (trees, rocks, carcasses, etc). Higher values increase the number of strikes needed to destroy them, increasing harvest yields
Sets the scaling factor for the resource node respawn rate (trees, rocks, bushes, etc). Lower values cause nodes to respawn more frequently
Sets the scaling factor for creature taming speed. Higher values make taming faster
Sets the scaling factor for swim speed, relative to the level spent in oxygen
If set, enables the structure stasis grid to improve server performance on large bases with lots of players. Structures are loaded based on grids with players. Not recommended for modded servers
If set, auto destruction of old structures will be enabled. The destruction timer can be adjusted with Auto Structure Destruction Multiplier
If set, any non-core/non-foundation structures will not be auto destroyed (assuming Auto Destroy Structures is enabled), except if a floor they are on is auto destroyed
If set, only unsnapped core structures will decay (be auto destroyed). Useful for eliminating lone pillar/foundation spam on servers in PvP mode
DisplayName: Only Auto Destroy Unsnapped Core Structures

Description: If set, the gradual (7 days) decay of player structures will be disabled in PvE mode
If set, the gradual decay of structures will be enabled in PvP mode
If set, unsnapped foundations/pillars will decay at 5x speed
Sets the cooldown period on structure repair from the last time damaged. 0 =  disabled (structures can always be repaired)
Sets the maximum number of platformed-creatures/rafts allowed on the server
Sets the number of "tamed creature slots" a platform saddle will use
If set, turret and spike structures will be buildable and functional on platform saddles
If set, completely disables building in specific resource-rich areas, in particular setup on The Island around the major mountains
DisplayName: Disable Building In Rich Resource Areas

Description: If set, from-the-air supply crates can appear on top of structures, rather than being prevented by structures
If set, building near supply drop points will be allowed in PvE mode
DisplayName: Allow PvE Structures At Supply Drops

Description: If set, allows for structures to clip into the terrain

Sets the path to a shared cluster directory for a server cluster. The cluster directory must be accessible to all cluster servers. If the server is in Docker, the directory must be mounted in the container
Sets the cluster ID for a server cluster. The cluster ID must be the same on all servers in the cluster
If set, prevents the download of characters from a cluster to the server
If set, prevents the download of survivors from a cluster to the server
If set, prevents the download of items from a cluster to the server
If set, prevents the download of tamed creatures from a cluster to the server
If set, prevents the upload of survivors from the server to a cluster
If set, prevents the upload of items from the server to a cluster
If set, prevents the upload of tamed creatures from the server to a cluster

If enabled, default backup exclusion configuration files are downloaded when the server is updated, to save space on AMP backups. If disabled, manually delete any .backupExclude files in the server base directory and in the ShooterGame directory to prevent backup exclusions
